item.title: Amazon to Invest Up to $4 Billion in Anthropic as AI Arms Race Escalates
item.description: The deal, which includes a broad partnership, follows Microsoft’s multibillion-dollar stake in rival startup OpenAI.

item.title: Metals Slide as Concerns Over Monetary Tightening Linger
item.description: Metals slipped as concerns over demand and the global economy continued to compound prices for industrial goods.

item.title: Dollar Stays Firm After Last Week's Fed Decision, Euro Still Vulnerable
item.description: The big focus this week will be eurozone inflation figures on Friday, where any weakness could lift the dollar against the euro, Swissquote Bank said.

item.title: Investors Might Need More Evidence of Macro Weakening to Add Duration
item.description: For investors to add duration there needs to be more evidence that macro trends are weakening, putting central banks’ goldilocks scenarios into question, Commerzbank Research said.

item.title: More Democratic lawmakers and officials are calling on Sen. Menendez to resign, after he was indicted in a bribery scheme.
item.description: More Democratic lawmakers and officials are calling on Sen. Menendez to resign, after he was indicted in a bribery scheme.

item.title: Meta is planning to release artificial intelligence chatbots as soon as this week with distinct personalities across its social-media apps as a way to attract young users, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Meta is planning to release artificial intelligence chatbots as soon as this week with distinct personalities across its social-media apps as a way to attract young users, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: The efforts by FTC Chair Lina Khan to protect competition are inadvertently enriching some on Wall Street, generating outsize profits for Pentwater Capital Management and other large hedge funds that bet on merger deals.
item.description: The efforts by FTC Chair Lina Khan to protect competition are inadvertently enriching some on Wall Street, generating outsize profits for Pentwater Capital Management and other large hedge funds that bet on merger deals.

item.title: Hawaiian Electric regularly fell behind on plans to replace utility poles at risk of failure and spent millions less on upgrades than planned in the years before a wildfire destroyed Lahaina this summer.
item.description: Hawaiian Electric regularly fell behind on plans to replace utility poles at risk of failure and spent millions less on upgrades than planned in the years before a wildfire destroyed Lahaina this summer.

item.title: Hollywood writers, studios and streamers said they have reached a tentative agreement that would end a monthslong strike, in a three-year deal including increased royalties and protections regarding the use of AI.
item.description: Hollywood writers, studios and streamers said they have reached a tentative agreement that would end a monthslong strike, in a three-year deal including increased royalties and protections regarding the use of AI.

item.title: NASA recovered a capsule carrying the largest sample ever collected from an asteroid after it was jettisoned from a robotic spacecraft and landed in a Utah desert.
item.description: NASA recovered a capsule carrying the largest sample ever collected from an asteroid after it was jettisoned from a robotic spacecraft and landed in a Utah desert.

item.title: After failing in Moscow's goal of a lightning victory in Ukraine, the Russian military has adapted on the battlefield as it shifts to a strategy of wearing down Ukraine and the West.
item.description: After failing in Moscow’s goal of a lightning victory in Ukraine, the Russian military has adapted on the battlefield as it shifts to a strategy of wearing down Ukraine and the West.

item.title: Congress heads into a make-or-break week for avoiding a government shutdown, with leaders of the Republican-controlled House hoping that they can persuade GOP holdouts to get on board with four full-year bills and a short-term funding patch.
item.description: Congress heads into a make-or-break week for avoiding a government shutdown, with leaders of the Republican-controlled House hoping that they can persuade GOP holdouts to get on board with four full-year bills and a short-term funding patch.

item.title: Usher will headline the halftime show for Super Bowl LVIII in Las Vegas next winter, the NFL said.
item.description: Usher will headline the halftime show for Super Bowl LVIII in Las Vegas next winter, the NFL said.

item.title: Cuts to international aid from some of Africa's biggest donors, and a litany of crises, mean humanitarian organizations are scaling back lifesaving medical services, food aid and other vital assistance.
item.description: Cuts to international aid from some of Africa’s biggest donors, and a litany of crises, mean humanitarian organizations are scaling back lifesaving medical services, food aid and other vital assistance.

item.title: Theme-park operators are pinning their hopes on a blockbuster fall season, betting that splashy Halloween and Oktoberfest events can make up for a summer season hurt by extreme weather.
item.description: Theme-park operators are pinning their hopes on a blockbuster fall season, betting that splashy Halloween and Oktoberfest events can make up for a summer season hurt by extreme weather.

item.title: The union representing Ford Motor's auto-factory workers in Canada said that it secured double-digit wage increases and improved pensions in its labor pact with the automaker.
item.description: The union representing Ford Motor’s auto-factory workers in Canada said that it secured double-digit wage increases and improved pensions in its labor pact with the automaker.

item.title: Initial public offering listings by Arm, Instacart and Klaviyo recently represented the chance to revitalize a market that has long been in disrepair, but the results have been inconclusive.
item.description: Initial public offering listings by Arm, Instacart and Klaviyo recently represented the chance to revitalize a market that has long been in disrepair, but the results have been inconclusive.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.9%, Led by Electronics, Tech Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics and tech stocks, as concerns eased about the Bank of Japan’s possible shift to a tighter policy.
